turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... Thank you.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Unfortunate, but I think we can work around it.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: And you want a --

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: A visual record, yes.  A before-and- after kind of thing.  This could make your reputation.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Maybe we should start with a portrait of the artist.  People might like to see the face behind the makeup.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: ... Behind the makeup?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I've seen worse.  Much worse.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Strong stomach, huh?  I like that in a woman -- Maybe we can do business after all.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... Why the mask?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Alicia!  Come here, have a seat.  Show Miss Vale why you wear the mask.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You SCUM!  You SICK FILTH!... You DID THAT to her!

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: What?  I improved her a little...

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'll see you burn.  I'll see you dead -- GET AWAY FROM ME!!

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Miss Vale, was it something I said?  Do you want to sniff my flower?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: How'd you know it was me?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Honey - - I would know any randomly selected square inch of Vicki Vale.  If I had a good enough hint.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Burned out.  I need a vacation.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Too much glamor, huh.  What's in the bag - - Monte Carlo?  Apes in Kenya?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: God, Vick, a girl could get hurt doing this.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: A girl could get killed - - so they tell me.  What's new and hot in Gotham City?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Oh, it's too good.  We got a six-foot bat that swoops out of the night and preys on evildoers.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Evildoers, huh?  Big or small?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Small so far.  I think he's leaving the big fish for Harvey Dent.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Our next D.A. -- I hear Bruce Wayne is throwing a fundraiser.  Did you get your invitation yet?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Oh, absolutely.  Bruce and I are very close.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Well, I'm starving.  Will you at least buy me a hamburger?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Man, I feel like Robin Leach.  You actually know all these people?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Some.  I am a rich bitch, remember?  I'm quoting.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Where does one man get all this junk?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: All aver the world.  They say he's spent half of his life overseas.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Holy shit...

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Rich.  Reclusive.  Bankrolls half a dozen charities.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Likes to kill? KNOX  Women find him magnetic.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: I bet they like him for his big charity balls.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: That, and the sweet smell of two hundred million bucks.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Well, you know me.  The more they've got, the less they're worth.  This guy must be the most worthless man in America.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Oh.  Sorry.  I was thinking.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: What were you thinking?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Yum, yum.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Well, he must like the way he looks.  He's got a mirror in every room.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Guess who's got a date with Bruce Wayne?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Bruce Wayne?  Date?  He called you up and asked you for a date?  Shit.  HEY, MIRANDA!  C'MERE!  Now pay close attention to this.  Miranda -- tell my friend here what you told me about Bruce Wayne.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Peanuts?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yeah.  Peanuts.  Which is how he goes through women.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Plain or roasted?  Alex, I'm very flattered that you've gone out and done all this research.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Why?  Aw, come on, Vicki, I'm a reporter. I'm curious.  I do this for a living.  There's a phone.  You can call him up and cancel.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Nice snap, huh?  Pulitzer Prize, 1963.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: His face.  Allie, look at his face.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yep.  He watched the whole thing happen - - Recognize the beat cop?  Jim Gordon

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Oh, Bruce...

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Something like this -- what do you suppose this could drive a guy to?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You are on drugs.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yeah?  According to this, he's in Geneva from '76 to '79. Well, I called Geneva.  Nobody there's even heard of the guy - - Probably off in Tibet with some kung fu master.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Are they paying you for all this?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Everybody needs a hobby.  You explain it, Vicki.  He walks out on his own party.  Half an hour later, who turns up?  Batman.  Sees an execution, freaks out in an alleyway.  No place to change.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Allie, I know exactly why you're doing this.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: ... Oh?  Why is that, Vicki?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: He's best friends with Jim Gordon and Harvey Dent.  They would know.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: ... Okay, then, I have a confession to make.  I'm the Batman.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Alexander... I know you.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Right.  And they know him.  And that's why it would never occur to them for a minute that their old buddy Bruce puts on a cape at night and goes out looking for --

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I've had it with you.  I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Bruce Wayne is out of his mind.  Next time you call him up and he can't go out Friday night - - think it over.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: The guy's bats all right. He's bat shit crazy. He --  -- I can't believe it. I was right!!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Allie, he's not.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Not what?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: He's not crazy.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Vicki. We got a wealthy millionaire here... who dresses up like a bat. He goes out at night and swings around -- in his cape -- on a rope.  CRAZY BAT-STARD!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Allie... he wants to tell me. I had a roll of film. His face was on it. He knew that -- And he let me keep.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Jesus, Vicki! Where is it??

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: It's gone.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Couldn't turn down the job, huh? A girl could get hurt this way.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Yeah. Deja vu.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: What do you say? Let's head for the lights.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: LOOK! IT'S BRUCE!!  Allies -- the balloons. We've got to find some way to tell him!

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Great. How??

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: HOLY SHIT!!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah. Little winded. DID YOU SEE THAT?!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: God yes, Allie. I've gotta say -- that was the ballsiest move I ever...

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Holy shit. Holy...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ahm, well, you know ~ that's a tough question - on one' level I think it ....

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Don't ask him about work, Charlie. Life's too short.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Jennifer can stay and look after Kevin

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sounds great.  Excellent.  Though-, Ahm... there's this guy who's coming to work at the Gallery, from England...

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Yeeees?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: And they asked me if we'd like to ... you know... put him up for a while.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: There aren't hotels?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, there are hotels.  They just thought maybe it'd be nice for him to stay with a real American family.  Popcorn, waffles, all that stuff.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: And what did you say?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I said I'd check with you.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Do we know anything about him?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ahm - he's male.  He's English.  He's a doctor of er ... at least 2 things.  I think they would have mentioned if he was a blind dwarf.  Or one of those guys who kills lots of people all the time.  I think we're looking at someone moderately normal here.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: David - are you ever going to learn to say 'no'?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.  Yes.  Sometime.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: It's the last thing we need.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's exactly what I said ... before I said - Great, it's a sensational idea."

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Scottish.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Tom Jones?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well, they're kind of busy but it doesn't look like ...

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Did you really ask?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm not sure I got the right person but they were a bit busy ...

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: What's wrong with you, David?  All you have to do is say, Excuse me, I've been sitting here since the start of the Millennium and I'd really like some action from you before the end of the world. I'll go.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: It isn't working any more, David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I know - I'11 take it in to George tomorrow'- he'll fix it.  Stupid thing.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: I need some time, David.  A little time.  It's not just you.  It's partly me.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I had the last strawberry in the refrigerator.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: There were three strawberries.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: One.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Liar.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: 0h Ali we can work this thing out, you know.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ali?  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Your face smells like a foot.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Shut up, Kevin.  Honey, you-re not making sense ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's okay.  There's no one out here. Just open the door.  Trust me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Okay.  It's not a problem... Let's just sit ... I'11 talk to the gallery ...

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: David, I'm serious!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I know you are.  Very serious ... most of the time these days.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Now what does that mean?  My daughter wakes up with a strange man in her bed, and I'm supposed to think it's amusing?  That tie's God-awful.  Why do you wear it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hi,

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Hi.....  Roses.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.  And	I have a wine for dinner that will kill you.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Great.  You said you'd ask Grierson about putting our guest somewhere else.  Did you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sort of half.....

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I was sort of half way through the sentence in which I would have asked him when it suddenly seemed like a mistake.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Honestly David, you're so spineless.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: At least you didn't bring Mr Bean with you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ah, well .... CUT TO:

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: 0 my god.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sorry, honey - he just happened to tag along.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Nothing ever really changes, does it, David?

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Let's get a coffee.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.  Great.  Kevin, I'11 send Bean in to keep you company.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Everything's gonna be fine.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: About Charles...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: shhh...

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: It was nothing.  We're not ... He just makes me laugh.  When was the last time we laughed?  Any of us?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I know... I know. I've been an arsehole of spectacular proportions. Olympic standard.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: Maybe I ought to think about getting another job.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Good idea - with a boss who's a really ugly son-of-a-bitch.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Here, let me do that.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: No, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: ALISON
turns.text: He's not too bad.  I can live with him.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm afraid you don't know the half of it. Sit down.  I have a tale to tell.  And not a happy one.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Two dollars please.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Annie, it's me.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, right, yeah.  two dollars please.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, Annie, no.  This is Doctor Bean. He's going to be working with us.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: He doesn't like to say much does he?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Right first time.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I can understand THAT. Neither do I.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Excuse me.  Mr Grierson called down. He's ready to see you upstairs.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Thanks, Annie.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Goodnight Annie.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Night.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Big day today, huh? 78

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Uh ... yes ...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: David.  There's a call for you.  It's your wife.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Great.  Classic timing.  Why don't you ask her just to leave a date for the divorce?  I'll check my diary later.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ah, Mr Bean ...

turns.speaker: BEAN
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Better go.  Grierson hates people being late.

turns.speaker: BEAN
turns.text: Yes.  Ahm... think I'11 ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Seems to be a problem with the door. Where's the picture gone?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?  What?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh Jesus.  Oh God.  Oh Jesus God.  Oh Mary Mother of Jesus. Oh Jesus of Nazareth.

turns.speaker: BEAN
turns.text: oh dear.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What happened?!!!

turns.speaker: BEAN
turns.text: Oh yes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Whistler was a great painter, but he wasn't a great chooser of paints ....

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It wasn't a dream, was it.  I have to go in to work and tell them Whistler's Mother now looks like Danny De Vito.

turns.speaker: BEAN
turns.text: Well, Ahm....

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's very good Bernie.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: But the particular glory of the system... is that it can also work oh large screens in each individual room - so we can network the program to every room in the gallery.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I was hoping DU.  Bean might take a look at my computer project today.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.  I'11 mention it to him.  But ... he's kind of his own guy, you know?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Howls he getting on with the family?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ah. Fine.  It's good.  It's great.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: And howls Alison?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: She's ... well, she's good.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Saw her at the movies the other night with that boss of hers.  Nice guy.  Good looking.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, isn't he.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: It's great when people who work together can become real friends.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Isn't it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look, I've left Bean on his own. Nice to chat though Bernie - always a subtle joy.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Thanks, David.  Always a pleasure.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: 'Emergency measures, in your book means sack people right?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Not necessarily.  That's where this ...  comes in.  No, I've had a better idea than sacking people.  You'll hear soon enough.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Great day.  At last we can start getting out of debt and concentrating on the future.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, look, I wanted to talk to you about this.  I'm sure we haven't been doing as badly as all that.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: You're an innocent and an optimist David - that's why I love you. .  Jesus - what a terrible tie- Come on, the Governor's coming at 3. And before then I have a little surprise for you and the Boss.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Everything okay, David?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.  Ahm.  I was just wondering where my English house guest had got to.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: He's just parking the Governor's car.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Great - keep him out of trouble.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look at all this - publicity expenditure ... catering ... all completely fictional ... back as far as June 93 ...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I don't think you really understand what you're looking at ...

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Lord Walton assures me this guy's one of the very top scholars in the English art world.  Has a couple of doctorates no less.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Great news.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: So ... I'm wondering if one of you would have this guy stay in your home instead of some expensive hotel.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Love to, sir, but no can do.  No spare room.  Period.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: David?

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: We'll be able to start this afternoon.  I'11 pipe the guide to every video screen in the gallery.  Now, that'll impress the Governor.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Well, bravo!  What with you and Whistler's Ma - I think I've got a winning team.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: What a pleasure, Governor Reynolds.  I'd like you to meet some of our staff here. .

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: And that's where you introduce me to the Governor.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Right.  Got it.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: This is Elmer, our longest serving...

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Hey.  Let's junk the medals, Elmer.  This is not a Veterans' reunion. We wanna make the Governor feel at home.  Not remind him of piles of dead people wearing uniforms.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Okay, that'll do.  The Governor's here in half an hour.  We have to be totally ready then.  No excuses.  Period!

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Thank you Bernie.  Well done.  Now, If you'll excuse - I have a little smartening up to do myself.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: He's a man with a plan who will haul us into profitability and the 21st century.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  Although, I'm afraid I don't quite see how we can ...

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Good point Bernie - precisely the kind of perceptive interjection I'd expect from my new V.P. How can we, you ask, survive without Whistler's Mother - our single greatest asset?  Well, the truth is - we can't.  So what am I saying?  Will we find her again?  Never - this robber was clearly the work of a criminal of great genius.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Say that again, son.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I said say that again, son - because the next time you do, I'll make sure you're in there with my daughter, but in a slightly less healthy state and she's in a coma with a broken arm right now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm er ... sorry if you've been waiting a long time.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We have.  In fact, we've been sitting here since the start of the Millennium and I'd really like some action from you before the end of the world.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So, why not haul your ...  nice little ass into this room and explain to me and my wife why our precious daughter is going to be absolutely fine because of all the fantastic intelligence and attention you are going to give her case.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay, sir.  Certainly.  Good.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, look, I mean, it's kind of the last thing... I mean, I'd really like to, but... things at home are kind of sensitive, so I couldn't really er ...

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: I thought perhaps as Vice-President, and in view of the unfortunate attendance's for the summer show this year... the MASSIVE financial LOSS ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: on the other hand ... maybe a breath of fresh air is just what my family needs ... Yes.  Great news.  Fabulous.  Triumphant.  Course it might need a little smoothing over.  When's he due?

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Tomorrow.  You have a problem with that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No. Perfect.  Looking forward to it. CUT TO:

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Ah, David.  Finally.  And this must be our professor from across the sea.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, this is Doctor Bean.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ah... He certainly has something, sir.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Very pleased you've taken him in, David.  At a time when no-one's job is safe, it really identifies you as a team player.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, although, I really..... thank you.  Yes, it's great to have him with us. The whole family's very excited.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Glad to hear it.  Tell poor Mr Larson to come through, will you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're not going to ....

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Sack him?  David, what else can I do?  This business is not, repeat, not breaking even. And David ... notice anything this morning?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Er ... pray tell me why?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: The thing is, sir, I've just been giving the painting a very thorough inspection, with the help of Dr Bean here - and we feel the time's come for Whistler's Mum to have her first face-lift.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Time taken its toll on the old girl, eh?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Exactly.  She's in a surprisingly terrible state.  Isn't she, Bean?

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Thank you David.  However, flattery will get you nowhere.  Truth is, I have a rather different plan for Whistler's dear Mama.  Bernie and I have been inspecting our books - and the long and short of it is, we cannot survive with our current losses, so ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... you have to sack me.  I understand, sir.  I'll go quietly.  In fact I'll go right now.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: No. no, no, hold on ... We cant sustain our loses - so I've decided.. to sell Whistler's Mother.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Brilliant, huh?  I already have a prospective buyer - the current Governor of California, no less, who is flies in tomorrow to inspect her and clinch the deal.  Spread the news.  I think decisive leadership has done the trick, don't you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, sir.  Yes, sir.  Congratulations. Marvellous thing.  Bravo.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: I think you're wrong, David.  She looks as fine as she's ever looked. Worth every cent of the 10 million dollar-s.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ahm....

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Bravo.  Let's put on a good show tomorrow, shall we?  Don't want anything to go wrong.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Quite right, sir.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Well, congratulations.  Isn't that great, David?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Certainly is.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: David, David, David ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm fired?  Because I let a... copy of a painting the get stolen?

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Of course not.  I'm sacking you for neglectful conduct, relating to the heavy financial loss this gallery has incurred, through your recent lack of professional judgement.  A loss I trust Bernie will be able to reverse.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: I owe you a very serious apology, young man.  It wouldn't surprise me if you wanted to leave us after this.  I sincerely hope that you do not.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: VERY ACCOMMODATING Well, no, sir, I'm sure ...

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: And a car.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Mmmmm...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Maybe two cars.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: A car sounds sensible.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: And I need Fridays off, to spend more time with my family.  Speaking of which - if you'll excuse me .... I've got a lot of time to make up.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh come on - the guy's going to be a creep.  All Englishmen are ugly.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: All the guys they claim are English to and good-looking like Dan Day- Lewis and Liam Neeson, turn out to be Irish.  Even Anthony Hopkins is welsh.  Prince Charles is so ugly they pay him two million bucks a year to stay indoors.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Richard Burton was very good-looking.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Welsh.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sean Connery.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Welsh again.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Okay, so the guy's gonna look like Meatloaf's backside.  No-one's asking you to go to bed with him.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Honey, calm down now... it's okay...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: There's a man.  I woke up next to a man ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jen - you don't wanna talk about it?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: It's you and Mom that need to talk.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sure.  You're right.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Bye, Dad.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ah ... Jennifer, I need you to watch Kevin.  Jen?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: As you can see, security's pretty tight in this section.  Nobody gets past Elmer here.  Isn't that right?

turns.speaker: ELMER
turns.text: Not in one piece anyway.  I see Mrs Whistler as kind of ... like my own dear mother.  I'd kill any man that tried to interfere with her.  The Vice President here will vouch for that.
